lead_paragraph: As you probably know from my  New York Times review, I'm genuinely excited about Windows Phone 7. True, nobody's exactly clamoring for yet another app-phone software platform-can Microsoft really offer anything that's sorely lacking by the iPhone or Android phones?-but the design is successful and completely different from what's come before. And the competition will keep Apple and Google on their toes.
snippet: A couple of simple fixes for the things that Microsoft Windows Phone 7 software didn't quite get to.
abstract: A couple of simple fixes for the things that Microsoft Windows Phone 7 software didn't quite get to.
